name: Get Channel
description: Get a channel by ID. Returns a channel object.  If the channel is a thread, a thread member object is included in the returned result.

name: Modify Channel
description: Update a channel's settings. Returns a channel on success, and a 400 BAD REQUEST on invalid parameters. All JSON parameters are optional.

name: Delete/Close Channel
description: Delete a channel, or close a private message. Requires the MANAGE_CHANNELS permission for the guild, or MANAGE_THREADS if the channel is a thread. Deleting a category does not delete its child channels; they will have their parent_id removed and a Channel Update Gateway event will fire for each of them. Returns a channel object on success. Fires a Channel Delete Gateway event (or Thread Delete if the channel was a thread).

name: Get Channel Messages

query.name: around
query.description: get messages around this message ID

query.name: before
query.description: get messages before this message ID

query.name: after
query.description: get messages after this message ID

query.name: limit
query.description: max number of messages to return

description: Returns the messages for a channel. If operating on a guild channel, this endpoint requires the VIEW_CHANNEL permission to be present on the current user. If the current user is missing the 'READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY' permission in the channel then this will return no messages . Returns an array of message objects on success.

name: Get Channel Message
description: Returns a specific message in the channel. If operating on a guild channel, this endpoint requires the 'READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY' permission to be present on the current user. Returns a message object on success.

name: Create Message
description: Post a message to a guild text or DM channel. Returns a message object. Fires a Message Create Gateway event. See message formatting for more information on how to properly format messages.

params.name: content
params.description: the message contents

params.name: tts
params.description: true if this is a TTS message

params.name: embeds
params.description: embedded `rich` content

params.name: embed
params.description: embedded `rich` content, deprecated in favor of `embeds`

params.name: allowed_mentions
params.description: allowed mentions for the message

params.name: message_reference
params.description: include to make your message a reply

params.name: components
params.description: the components to include with the message

params.name: sticker_ids
params.description: IDs of up to 3  in the server to send in the message

params.name: files
params.description: the contents of the file being sent

params.name: payload_json
params.description: JSON encoded body of non-file params

params.name: attachments
params.description: attachment objects with filename and description

params.name: flags
params.description: combined as a

name: Crosspost Message
description: Crosspost a message in a News Channel to following channels. This endpoint requires the 'SEND_MESSAGES' permission, if the current user sent the message, or additionally the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission, for all other messages, to be present for the current user.

name: Create Reaction

value:
the message. This endpoint requires the 'READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY' permission to be present on the current user. Additionally, if nobody else has reacted to the message using this emoji, this endpoint requires the 'ADD_REACTIONS' permission to be present on the current user. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
The emoji must be URL Encoded
the request will fail with 10014: Unknown Emoji . To use custom emoji, you must encode it in the f
mat name:id with the emoji name and emoji id.

description:
Create a reaction for the message. This endpoint requires the 'READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY' permission to be present on the current user. Additionally, if nobody else has reacted to the message using this emoji, this endpoint requires the 'ADD_REACTIONS' permission to be present on the current user. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
The emoji must be URL Encoded or the request will fail with 10014: Unknown Emoji . To use custom emoji, you must encode it in the format name:id with the emoji name and emoji id.

name: Delete Own Reaction

value: Delete a reaction the current user has made f

the message. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
The emoji must be URL Encoded
the request will fail with 10014: Unknown Emoji . To use custom emoji, you must encode it in the f
mat name:id with the emoji name and emoji id.

description:
Delete a reaction the current user has made for the message. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
The emoji must be URL Encoded or the request will fail with 10014: Unknown Emoji . To use custom emoji, you must encode it in the format name:id with the emoji name and emoji id.

name: Delete User Reaction

value:
Deletes another user's reaction. This endpoint requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission to be present on the current user. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
The emoji must be URL Encoded
the request will fail with 10014: Unknown Emoji . To use custom emoji, you must encode it in the f
mat name:id with the emoji name and emoji id.

description:
Deletes another user's reaction. This endpoint requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission to be present on the current user. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
The emoji must be URL Encoded or the request will fail with 10014: Unknown Emoji . To use custom emoji, you must encode it in the format name:id with the emoji name and emoji id.

name: Get Reactions

query.name: after
query.description: get users after this user ID

query.name: limit
query.description: max number of users to return

description:
Get a list of users that reacted with this emoji. Returns an array of user objects on success.
The emoji must be URL Encoded or the request will fail with 10014: Unknown Emoji . To use custom emoji, you must encode it in the format name:id with the emoji name and emoji id.

name: Delete All Reactions
description: Deletes all reactions on a message. This endpoint requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission to be present on the current user. Fires a Message Reaction Remove All Gateway event.

name: Delete All Reactions for Emoji
description:
Deletes all the reactions for a given emoji on a message. This endpoint requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission to be present on the current user. Fires a Message Reaction Remove Emoji Gateway event.
The emoji must be URL Encoded or the request will fail with 10014: Unknown Emoji . To use custom emoji, you must encode it in the format name:id with the emoji name and emoji id.

name: Edit Message

value: Edit a previously sent message. The fields content , embeds , and flags can be edited by the
. Other users can only edit flags and only if they have the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission in the c

responding channel. When specifying flags, ensure to include all previously set flags/bits in addition to ones that you are modifying. Only flags documented in the table below may be modified by users .

description: Edit a previously sent message. The fields content , embeds , and flags can be edited by the original message author. Other users can only edit flags and only if they have the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission in the corresponding channel. When specifying flags, ensure to include all previously set flags/bits in addition to ones that you are modifying. Only flags documented in the table below may be modified by users .

params.name: content
params.description: the message contents

params.name: embeds
params.description: embedded `rich` content

params.name: embed
params.description: embedded `rich` content, deprecated in favor of `embeds`

params.name: flags
params.description: edit the  of a message

params.name: allowed_mentions
params.description: allowed mentions for the message

params.name: components
params.description: the components to include with the message

params.name: files
params.description: the contents of the file being sent/edited

params.name: payload_json
params.description: JSON encoded body of non-file params

params.name: attachments
params.description: attached files to keep and possible descriptions for new files

name: Delete Message

value: Delete a message. If operating on a guild channel and trying to delete a message that was not sent by the current user, this endpoint requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Message Delete Gateway event.

description: Delete a message. If operating on a guild channel and trying to delete a message that was not sent by the current user, this endpoint requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Message Delete Gateway event.

name: Bulk Delete Messages

value: Delete multiple messages in a single request. This endpoint can only be used on guild channels and requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Message Delete Bulk Gateway event.

description: Delete multiple messages in a single request. This endpoint can only be used on guild channels and requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Message Delete Bulk Gateway event.

params.name: messages
params.description: an array of message ids to delete

name: Edit Channel Permissions

value: Edit the channel permission overwrites f
role in a channel. Only usable f
guild channels. Requires the MANAGE_ROLES permission. Only permissions your bot has in the guild
channel can be allowed/denied . Returns a 204 empty response on success. F

description: Edit the channel permission overwrites for a user or role in a channel. Only usable for guild channels. Requires the MANAGE_ROLES permission. Only permissions your bot has in the guild or channel can be allowed/denied (unless your bot has a MANAGE_ROLES overwrite in the channel). Returns a 204 empty response on success. For more information about permissions, see permissions .

params.name: allow
params.description: the bitwise value of all allowed permissions

params.name: deny
params.description: the bitwise value of all disallowed permissions

params.name: type
params.description: 0 for a role or 1 for a member

name: Get Channel Invites
description: Returns a list of invite objects (with invite metadata ) for the channel. Only usable for guild channels. Requires the MANAGE_CHANNELS permission.

name: Create Channel Invite
description: Create a new invite object for the channel. Only usable for guild channels. Requires the CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE permission. All JSON parameters for this route are optional, however the request body is not. If you are not sending any fields, you still have to send an empty JSON object ( {} ). Returns an invite object. Fires an Invite Create Gateway event.

params.name: max_age
params.description: duration of invite in seconds before expiry, or 0 for never. between 0 and 604800

params.name: max_uses
params.description: max number of uses or 0 for unlimited. between 0 and 100

params.name: temporary
params.description: whether this invite only grants temporary membership

params.name: unique
params.description: if true, don't try to reuse a similar invite

params.name: target_type
params.description: the  for this voice channel invite

params.name: target_user_id
params.description: the id of the user whose stream to display for this invite, required if `target_type` is 1, the user must be streaming in the channel

params.name: target_application_id
params.description: the id of the embedded application to open for this invite, required if `target_type` is 2, the application must have the `EMBEDDED` flag

name: Delete Channel Permission

value: Delete a channel permission overwrite f
role in a channel. Only usable f
guild channels. Requires the MANAGE_ROLES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success. F

description: Delete a channel permission overwrite for a user or role in a channel. Only usable for guild channels. Requires the MANAGE_ROLES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success. For more information about permissions, see permissions

name: Follow News Channel
description: Follow a News Channel to send messages to a target channel. Requires the MANAGE_WEBHOOKS permission in the target channel. Returns a followed channel object.

params.name: webhook_channel_id
params.description: id of target channel

name: Trigger Typing Indicator

value: the specified channel. Generally bots should not implement this route. However, if a bot is responding to a command and expects the computation to take a few seconds, this endpoint may be called to let the user know that the bot is processing their message. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Typing Start Gateway event.

description: Post a typing indicator for the specified channel. Generally bots should not implement this route. However, if a bot is responding to a command and expects the computation to take a few seconds, this endpoint may be called to let the user know that the bot is processing their message. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Typing Start Gateway event.

name: Get Pinned Messages
description: Returns all pinned messages in the channel as an array of message objects.

name: Pin Message

value: Pin a message in a channel. Requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success.

description: Pin a message in a channel. Requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success.

name: Unpin Message

value: Unpin a message in a channel. Requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success.

description: Unpin a message in a channel. Requires the MANAGE_MESSAGES permission. Returns a 204 empty response on success.

name: Group DM Add Recipient
description: Adds a recipient to a Group DM using their access token.

params.name: access_token
params.description: access token of a user that has granted your app the `gdm.join` scope

params.name: nick
params.description: nickname of the user being added

name: Group DM Remove Recipient
description: Removes a recipient from a Group DM.

name: Start Thread with Message
description: Creates a new thread from an existing message. Returns a channel on success, and a 400 BAD REQUEST on invalid parameters. Fires a Thread Create Gateway event.

params.name: name
params.description: 1-100 character channel name

params.name: auto_archive_duration
params.description: duration in minutes to automatically archive the thread after recent activity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080

params.name: rate_limit_per_user
params.description: amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message

name: Start Thread without Message
description: Creates a new thread that is not connected to an existing message. The created thread defaults to a GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD  . Returns a channel on success, and a 400 BAD REQUEST on invalid parameters. Fires a Thread Create Gateway event.

params.name: name
params.description: 1-100 character channel name

params.name: auto_archive_duration
params.description: duration in minutes to automatically archive the thread after recent activity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080

params.name: type
params.description: the  to create

params.name: invitable
params.description: whether non-moderators can add other non-moderators to a thread; only available when creating a private thread

params.name: rate_limit_per_user
params.description: amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message

name: Join Thread

value: Adds the current user to a thread. Also requires the thread is not archived. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Thread Members Update Gateway event.

description: Adds the current user to a thread. Also requires the thread is not archived. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Thread Members Update Gateway event.

name: Add Thread Member

value: Adds another member to a thread. Requires the ability to send messages in the thread. Also requires the thread is not archived. Returns a 204 empty response if the member is successfully added
was already a member  the thread. Fires a Thread Members Update Gateway event.

description: Adds another member to a thread. Requires the ability to send messages in the thread. Also requires the thread is not archived. Returns a 204 empty response if the member is successfully added or was already a member of the thread. Fires a Thread Members Update Gateway event.

name: Leave Thread

value: Removes the current user from a thread. Also requires the thread is not archived. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Thread Members Update Gateway event.

description: Removes the current user from a thread. Also requires the thread is not archived. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Thread Members Update Gateway event.

name: Remove Thread Member

value: Removes another member from a thread. Requires the MANAGE_THREADS permission,
the thread if it is a GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD . Also requires the thread is not archived. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Thread Members Update Gateway event.

description: Removes another member from a thread. Requires the MANAGE_THREADS permission, or the creator of the thread if it is a GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD . Also requires the thread is not archived. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Thread Members Update Gateway event.

name: Get Thread Member
description: Returns a thread member object for the specified user if they are a member of the thread, returns a 404 response otherwise.

name: List Thread Members
description: Returns array of thread members objects that are members of the thread.

name: List Active Threads

value: Returns all active threads in the channel, including public and private threads. Threads are
dered by their id , in descending

description: Returns all active threads in the channel, including public and private threads. Threads are ordered by their id , in descending order.

name: List Public Archived Threads

query.name: limit
query.description: optional maximum number of threads to return

description: Returns archived threads in the channel that are public. When called on a GUILD_TEXT channel, returns threads of type  GUILD_PUBLIC_THREAD . When called on a GUILD_NEWS channel returns threads of type  GUILD_NEWS_THREAD . Threads are ordered by archive_timestamp , in descending order. Requires the READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY permission.

name: List Private Archived Threads

query.name: limit
query.description: optional maximum number of threads to return

description: Returns archived threads in the channel that are of type  GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD . Threads are ordered by archive_timestamp , in descending order. Requires both the READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY and MANAGE_THREADS permissions.

name: List Joined Private Archived Threads

query.name: limit
query.description: optional maximum number of threads to return

description: Returns archived threads in the channel that are of type  GUILD_PRIVATE_THREAD , and the user has joined. Threads are ordered by their id , in descending order. Requires the READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY permission.
